page.title: 10TALBOT COMPUTER OFFICES
page.content: Peugeot-Talbot Car Company have a purpose-designed computer building, opened in 1984. About 110 people work in this two storey building where the big Amdahl V7 computer operates 24 hours a day, carrying out four very important functions. These are working out salaries, collecting information from dealers and sales, ordering materials and checking stock. In the computer room a false floor hides miles of cables which control the temperature as this is vitally important to the efficient running of the computers. The centre even has its own electrical sub-station. A tape library houses about 8,500 tapes. Upstairs are the areas for programming, systems design and other support needed in linking up Tile Hill with various parts of the United Kingdom and other parts of Europe.
